instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.P3V3SUS_EN: What is P3V3SUS_EN? P3V3SUS_EN is a signal that turns on the PP3V3_SUS power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high..
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - not turning on/orange light - <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> corroded
threads.message:
Hey guys,

hope you can help me with this one.

Board is looking nice, except <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> area.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is present

<SIGNAL>P3V3SUS_EN</SIGNAL> is not present...?!

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> is like 0.01V

Should i replace <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> directly? Or any other options first to check?


[ATTACH type="full"]60570[/ATTACH]


Thank you!

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - not turning on/orange light - <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> corroded
threads.message:
You must clean the corrosion and replace damaged components.
Remove <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, clean its pads and ones from board; check traces continuity and resolder back the chip.
Check diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>; w/ and w/o <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> in place.

Do not reflash BIOS yet.
Only change <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> if it causes short.

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - not turning on/orange light - <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> corroded
threads.message:
Hi!

Just gave some flux and hot air to the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> to see what happens: (had light before the whole time)

no light at all - and i discovered that <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> looks like shit

[ATTACH type="full"]60571[/ATTACH]


hows that/is it possible?!


replace <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> and fix traces - should be a working machine?!

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - not turning on/orange light - <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> corroded
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7090</CHIP> is the <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> power supply.
Did you test the machine now?

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - not turning on/orange light - <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> corroded
threads.message:
update:

replaced <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>; jumper wire to <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR>

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is 1.7V

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 0.5 something


whatÂ´s going on with this machine?

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - not turning on/orange light - <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> corroded
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> voltages.
Also check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - not turning on/orange light - <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> corroded
threads.message:
pin 6, 8: 2,7

diode mode to ground: both: 0.333
